intro: Epilobium nakaianum, commonly known as the New Zealand willow, is a herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Epilobium nakaianum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
